text:
Company: Hobbs, Oconnor and Thomas

Role: Administrative Business Promotion Coordinator

Company Background: Hobbs, Oconnor and Thomas is a leading marketing firm specializing in innovative business solutions and strategic promotional campaigns. We are dedicated to helping our clients achieve their business goals through our exceptional service and expertise.

Job Description: We are seeking an Administrative Business Promotion Coordinator to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will be responsible for coordinating promotional activities, managing client relationships, and supporting the administrative needs of our marketing department.

Responsibilities:
- Coordinate and manage promotional campaigns.
- Develop and maintain relationships with clients.
- Support the administrative functions of the marketing department.
- Conduct physical inventory counts as required.
- Work in an open office environment with potential distractions.
- Stand for long periods during events or office hours.
- Meet tight deadlines with excellent time management skills.
- Work in noisy environments when necessary.

Qualifications and Experience:
- Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field.
- Proven experience in promotional activities and administrative support.
- Excellent time management skills.
- Ability to perform physical inventory counts.
- Comfortable working in open office and noisy environments.
- Ability to stand for long periods.
- Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.

Perks and Benefits:
- Full-time position with a salary ranging from $45,000 to $55,000 per year, based on experience and skills.
- Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
- Paid time off and holiday leave.
- Professional development opportunities.
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment.

Application Process: Interested candidates should submit their resume and a cover letter outlining their qualifications and experience. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.
